name: darkvishnya

procedures: T1040::[DarkVishnya] used network sniffing to obtain login data.
T1046::[DarkVishnya] performed port scanning to obtain the list of active services.
T1059.001::[DarkVishnya] used PowerShell to create shellcode loaders.
T1110::[DarkVishnya] used brute-force attack to obtain login data.
T1135::[DarkVishnya] scanned the network for public shared folders.
T1200::[DarkVishnya] used Bash Bunny, Raspberry Pi, netbooks or inexpensive laptops to connect to the companyâ€™s local network.
T1219::[DarkVishnya] used DameWare Mini Remote Control for lateral movement.
T1543.003::[DarkVishnya] created new services for shellcode loaders distribution.
T1571::[DarkVishnya] used ports 5190 and 7900 for shellcode listeners, and 4444, 4445, 31337 for shellcode C2.
T1588.002::[DarkVishnya] has obtained and used tools such as [Impacket], [Winexe], and [PsExec].

description: [DarkVishnya](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0105) is a financially motivated threat actor targeting financial institutions in Eastern Europe. In 2017-2018 the group attacked at least 8 banks in this region.(Citation: Securelist DarkVishnya Dec 2018)
